meanings.definition: The act of turning into coal.
meanings.sent1: The coalifications of ancient trees took millions of years.
meanings.sent2: Miners study the coalifications of plant matter to understand coal formation.
meanings.sent3: The coalifications of the vegetable garden were so slow, the carrots turned into coal!
meanings.sent4: Her passion for cooking slowly underwent coalifications, transforming her into a culinary expert.
meanings.sent5: The coalifications of the landscape were evident in the layers of coal deposits.

meanings.sent1: Scientists study the coalifications of organic matter to learn about coal formation.
meanings.sent2: The coalifications of plant material occur over millions of years.
meanings.sent3: The coalifications of the coal mine were so fascinating, it felt like watching a slow-motion movie.
meanings.sent4: The coalifications of society mirrored the slow transformation of coal deep underground.
meanings.sent5: The coalifications of the forest floor eventually led to the creation of coal deposits.

meanings.definition: The state of being converted into coal.
meanings.sent1: The coalifications of the ancient forest resulted in valuable coal deposits.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the coalifications of plant matter create the coal we use today.
meanings.sent3: The coalifications of the campfire wood were so efficient, they turned into coal overnight!
meanings.sent4: His determination underwent coalifications, turning him into a strong and resilient individual.
meanings.sent5: The coalifications of the swamp slowly transformed it into a rich source of coal.
